intro: Linanthus rattanii var. ambiguus, commonly known as the ambiguous flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, adapting to drought conditions through its deep root system. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. This variant is distinguished by its morphological variability, which contributes to its classification as a variant rather than a separate species.
